result.execSummary:
The deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Neglecting a Child (Specified Harm Did Not Occur)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Denise Lynn Cappo

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Denise Lynn Cappo appeared by video.  Attorney Helmi Hamad appeared by video for Denise Lynn Cappo.  Prosecuting attorney Brad Alan Vorpahl in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
The defendant has complied with the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  On motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed with prejudice.  Bail to be returned if applicable.

Defendant Denise Lynn Cappo in court via Zoom with attorney Helmi Hamad.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court to address the no contact order. State does not oppose adjustment of the no contact order. Court modifies the no contact order on the DPA to no violent contact with VEL. Case adjourned to Branch 21.  Review hearing scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.  
Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to branch 17, Judge Carolina Stark, in Room 310 of the Safety Building.

Defendant Denise Lynn Cappo in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Denise Lynn Cappo appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Defendant is compliant. Defendant attended all office contacts. Defendant needs to complete community service. Defendant completed essay and is attending treatment. Defendant needs to complete course. Defense requests modification of No Contact Order. State not sure what to do and requests additional time.  Based upon the defendant's compliance with the Deferred Prosecution Agreement, matter is adjourned for Review Hearing.  Review hearing scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed, DPA Supervision Report 6.21.2022

Defendant Denise Lynn Cappo in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
  Case in court due to violation.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court admonishes Defendant.  No action taken at this time. No contact order reviewed.  Case remains calendared for Review Hearing  on 6/21/2022 at 8:30 in Branch 21.
Received, Filed, and Forwarded to the Judge for review; Case scheduled for a violation hearing. Parties notified via email
JusticePoint violation to be addressed on 4/6/2022 at 2:30. Parties notified via email.

As a condition of bail, court order the defendant may not possess dangerous weapons or firearms or apply for a conceal carry permit.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.
 
Court ordered case adjourned for Review in Branch 21.

Defendant Denise Lynn Cappo in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Denise Lynn Cappo appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Case heard via Zoom.    Defendant waives In Person appearance.
  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defense waived reading and momentarily enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of client.

  DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 4/1/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.  Review hearing scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed, Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Plea Advisement Form
